message: Yobongo? What about Yobongo?
I haven't really gotten to play with GroupMe since it added non SMS interaction...I need to.
http://trese.cs.utwente.nl/taosad/SoftwareArchitecture/Images/relativity.jpg
I don't need to do this on the go. And I don't want to know everyone in the group.
Oh shit. We've gone meta already.
my original question was rhetorical. sorry for the confusion
yobongo
I'm going with convore for the group chat about group chats.
@rwwmike well at least for public discussion it seems to make more sense
It does. yes. At least none of the other four would make any sense for it.

Yobongo has no memory. You go on once and you're in one group...but then if you sign on again 20 minutes later, it could be a completely different group with different chat history. Very odd experience, actually. Very real-time...
I throw my vote to Beluga if any group chat discussion is taken mobile.
I was happy to see Groupme add messaging over data. I still lean more toward Beluga. Though that could change once the Facebook acquisition plays out.
@leah Is there confusion? Shoot. NOW I'm confused. ;)
FastSociety
Beluga is good for when you are mobile, but it gets annoying since they do not have any computer client. Though facebook just acquired Beluga, so there may be something on the horizon.
We do have a web component. Visit belugapods.com
!! Yes, I must have just missed it.
Anyone know what the plans are foe Facebook and Beluga? I'm currently using whatsapp but I prefer to use Beluga.
They haven't announced anything yet. I think this is a longer play for Facebook...given the four month rollout of their messaging system...
